member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkHelper
member.summary: Static utility methods for CHunks
member.remarks: Client code should rarely need this, see PngMetada and ChunksList

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkHelper.ToBytes(System.String)
member.summary: Converts to bytes using Latin1 (ISO-8859-1)

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkHelper.ToString(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Converts to String using Latin1 (ISO-8859-1)

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkHelper.ToString(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts to String using Latin1 (ISO-8859-1)

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkHelper.ToBytesUTF8(System.String)
member.summary: Converts to bytes using UTF-8

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkHelper.ToStringUTF8(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Converts to string using UTF-8

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkHelper.ToStringUTF8(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts to string using UTF-8

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkHelper.WriteBytesToStream(System.IO.Stream,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Writes full array of bytes to stream

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkHelper.IsCritical(System.String)
member.summary: Critical chunks: first letter is uppercase

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkHelper.IsPublic(System.String)
member.summary: Public chunks: second letter is uppercase

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkHelper.IsSafeToCopy(System.String)
member.summary: Safe to copy chunk: fourth letter is lower case

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkHelper.IsUnknown(Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk)
member.summary: We consider a chunk as "unknown" if our chunk factory (even when it has been augmented by client code) doesn't recognize it

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkHelper.PosNullByte(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Finds position of null byte in array

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkHelper.ShouldLoad(System.String,Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkLoadBehaviour)
member.summary: Decides if a chunk should be loaded, according to a ChunkLoadBehaviour

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkHelper.FilterList(System.Collections.Generic.List{Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk},Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkPredicate)
member.summary: Filters a list of Chunks, keeping those which match the predicate
member.remarks: The original list is not altered

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkHelper.TrimList(System.Collections.Generic.List{Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk},Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkPredicate)
member.summary: Filters a list of Chunks, removing those which match the predicate
member.remarks: The original list is not altered

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkHelper.Equivalent(Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk,Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk)
member.summary: Ad-hoc criteria for 'equivalent' chunks.
member.remarks: Two chunks are equivalent if they have the same Id AND either: 1. they are Single 2. both are textual and have the same key 3. both are SPLT and have the same palette name Bear in mind that this is an ad-hoc, non-standard, nor required (nor wrong) criterion. Use it only if you find it useful. Notice that PNG allows to have repeated textual keys with same keys.

member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunksList
member.summary:
All chunks that form an image, read or to be written
http://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/#table53

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunksList.chunks
member.summary: Includes all chunks, but IDAT is a single pseudo chunk without data

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunksList.GetChunksKeys
member.summary: Keys of processed (read or writen) chunks
member.returns: key:chunk id, val: number of occurrences

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunksList.GetChunks
member.summary: Returns a copy of the chunk list (but the chunks are not copied)
member.remarks: This should not be used for general metadata handling

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunksList.AppendReadChunk(Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds chunk in next position. This is used only by the pngReader

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunksList.GetById(System.String)
member.summary: All chunks with this ID
member.remarks: The GetBy... methods never include queued chunks

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunksList.GetById(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Same as ID, but we an additional discriminator for textual keys
member.remarks: If innerid!=null and the chunk is PngChunkTextVar or PngChunkSPLT, it's filtered by that id
member.param: Only used for text and SPLT chunks

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunksList.GetById1(System.String)
member.summary: Returns only one chunk
member.returns: First chunk found, null if not found

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunksList.GetById1(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns only one chunk
member.param: true, and more than one found: exception

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunksList.GetById1(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sames as GetById1(String id, bool failIfMultiple) but allows an additional innerid
member.param: true, and more than one found: exception

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunksList.GetEquivalent(Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk)
member.summary: Finds all chunks "equivalent" to this one

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunksList.ToString
member.summary: Only the amount of chunks

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunksList.ToStringFull
member.summary: Detailed information, for debugging

member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkLoadBehaviour
member.summary: Defines what to do with non critical chunks when reading

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkLoadBehaviour.LOAD_CHUNK_NEVER
member.summary: all non-critical chunks are skippped

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkLoadBehaviour.LOAD_CHUNK_KNOWN
member.summary: load chunk if 'known' (registered with the factory)

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkLoadBehaviour.LOAD_CHUNK_IF_SAFE
member.summary: load chunk if 'known' or safe to copy

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkLoadBehaviour.LOAD_CHUNK_ALWAYS
member.summary:
load chunks always
Notice that other restrictions might apply, see PngReader.SkipChunkMaxSize PngReader.SkipChunkIds

member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkRaw
member.summary: Wraps the raw chunk data
member.remarks:
Short lived object, to be created while serialing/deserializing
Do not reuse it for different chunks
See http://www.libpng.org/pub/png/spec/1.2/PNG-Chunks.html

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkRaw.Len
member.summary: The length counts only the data field, not itself, the chunk type code, or the CRC. Zero is a valid length. Although encoders and decoders should treat the length as unsigned, its value must not exceed 2^31-1 bytes.

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkRaw.IdBytes
member.summary: Chunk Id, as array of 4 bytes

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkRaw.Data
member.summary: Raw data, crc not included

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkRaw.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an empty raw chunk

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkRaw.ComputeCrc
member.summary: Called after setting data, before writing to os

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkRaw.ReadChunkData(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Position before: just after chunk id. positon after: after crc Data should be already allocated. Checks CRC Return number of byte read.

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkRaw.ToString
member.summary: Just id and length

member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunksListForWrite
member.summary: Chunks written or queued to be written http://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/#table53

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunksListForWrite.GetQueuedById(System.String)
member.summary: Same as getById(), but looking in the queued chunks

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunksListForWrite.GetQueuedById(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Same as getById(), but looking in the queued chunks

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunksListForWrite.GetQueuedById1(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Same as getById(), but looking in the queued chunks

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunksListForWrite.GetQueuedById1(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Same as getById1(), but looking in the queued chunks

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunksListForWrite.GetQueuedById1(System.String)
member.summary: Same as getById1(), but looking in the queued chunks

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunksListForWrite.RemoveChunk(Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk)
member.summary: Remove Chunk: only from queued
member.remarks: WARNING: this depends on chunk.Equals() implementation, which is straightforward for SingleChunks. For MultipleChunks, it will normally check for reference equality!

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunksListForWrite.Queue(Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk)
member.summary: Adds chunk to queue
member.remarks: Does not check for duplicated or anything

members.member: this should be called only for ancillary chunks and PLTE (groups 1 - 3 - 5)

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunksListForWrite.GetQueuedChunks
member.summary: chunks not yet writen - does not include IHDR, IDAT, END, perhaps yes PLTE
member.returns: THis is not a copy! Don't modify

member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkCopyBehaviour
member.summary: Behaviours for chunks transfer when reading and writing.
member.remarks: They are bitmasks, can be OR-ed

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkCopyBehaviour.COPY_NONE
member.summary: Don't copy any chunk

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkCopyBehaviour.COPY_PALETTE
member.summary: Copy the Palette, if present

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkCopyBehaviour.COPY_ALL_SAFE
member.summary: Copy all SAFE chunks

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkCopyBehaviour.COPY_ALL
member.summary: Copy all chunks (includes palette)

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkCopyBehaviour.COPY_PHYS
member.summary: Copy Physical resolution (DPI)

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkCopyBehaviour.COPY_TEXTUAL
member.summary: Copy all textual chunks (not safe)

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkCopyBehaviour.COPY_TRANSPARENCY
member.summary: Copy transparency (not safe)

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkCopyBehaviour.COPY_UNKNOWN
member.summary: Copy chunks unknown by our factory

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkCopyBehaviour.COPY_ALMOSTALL
member.summary: Copy all known, except HIST, TIME and textual

member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkPredicate
member.summary: Decides if another chunk "matches", according to some criterion

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkPredicate.Matches(Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk)
member.summary: The other chunk matches with this one

member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkPredicateId
member.summary: Match if have same Chunk Id

member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkPredicateId2
member.summary: match if have same id and, if Text (or SPLT) if have the asame key
member.remarks: This is the same as ChunkPredicateEquivalent, the only difference is that does not requires a chunk at construction time

member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkPredicateEquiv
member.summary: An ad-hoc criterion, perhaps useful, for equivalence.

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkPredicateEquiv.#ctor(Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk)
member.summary: Creates predicate based of reference chunk

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkPredicateEquiv.Matches(Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk)
member.summary: Check for match

member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunkMultiple
member.summary: A Chunk type that allows duplicate in an image

member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunkSingle
member.summary: A Chunk type that does not allow duplicate in an image

member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngMetadata
member.summary: Image Metadata, wrapper over a ChunksList
member.remarks: Additional image info, apart from the ImageInfo and the pixels themselves. Includes Palette and ancillary chunks. This class provides a wrapper over the collection of chunks of a image (read or to write) and provides some high level methods to access them

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngMetadata.QueueChunk(Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Queues the chunk at the writer
member.remarks: Warning: the overwriting applies to equivalent chunks, see ChunkPredicateEquiv and will only make sense for queued (not yet writen) chunks

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngMetadata.QueueChunk(Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk)
member.summary: Queues the chunk at the writer

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngMetadata.GetDpi
member.summary: Returns physical resolution, in DPI, in both coordinates
member.returns: [dpix,dpiy], -1 if not set or unknown dimensions

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngMetadata.SetDpi(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets physical resolution, in DPI
member.remarks: This is a utility method that creates and enqueues a PHYS chunk

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngMetadata.SetDpi(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets physical resolution, in DPI, both value in x and y dimensions
member.remarks: This is a utility method that creates and enqueues a PHYS chunk

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngMetadata.SetTimeNow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a TIME chunk, nsecs in the past from now.
member.param: Seconds in the past. If negative, it's a future time

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngMetadata.SetTimeNow
member.summary: Creates a TIME chunk with current time.

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngMetadata.SetTimeYMDHMS(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a TIME chunk with given date and time

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngMetadata.GetTime
member.summary: Gets image timestamp, TIME chunk
member.returns: TIME chunk, null if not present

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngMetadata.GetTimeAsString
member.summary: Gets image timestamp, TIME chunk, as a String
member.returns: Formated TIME, empty string if not present

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngMetadata.SetText(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a text chunk and enqueues it
member.param: Flag. If false, will use UTF-8 (iTXt)

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngMetadata.SetText(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a plain text chunk (tEXT) and enqueues it

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngMetadata.GetTxtsForKey(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves all text chunks with a given key
member.remarks: Can mix tEXt zTXt and iTXt chunks

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngMetadata.GetTxtForKey(System.String)
member.summary: Joins all strings for a given key
member.returns: Concatenated (with newlines) if several found, empty string if none
member.remarks: You'd perhaps prefer GetTxtsForKey

members.member:
Returns the TRNS chunk, if present
@return null if not present
Creates a new empty TRNS chunk, queues it for write and return it to the caller, who should fill its entries

member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunkSTER
member.summary: sTER chunk: http://www.libpng.org/pub/png/spec/register/pngext-1.3.0-pdg.html#C.sTER

member.name: P:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunkSTER.Mode
member.summary: 0: cross-fuse layout 1: diverging-fuse layout

member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunkOFFS
member.summary: oFFs chunk: http://www.libpng.org/pub/png/spec/register/pngext-1.3.0-pdg.html#C.oFFs

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunkOFFS.GetUnits
member.summary: 0: pixel, 1:micrometer

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunkOFFS.SetUnits(System.Int32)
member.summary: 0: pixel, 1:micrometer

member.summary: sPLT chunk: http://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/#11sPLT

member.name: P:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunkSPLT.PalName
member.summary: Must be unique in image

member.name: P:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunkSPLT.Palette
member.summary: 5 elements per entry

member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunkHIST
member.summary: hIST chunk, see http://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/#11hIST Only for palette images

member.summary: should have same length as palette

member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunkCHRM
member.summary: cHRM chunk, see http://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/#11cHRM

member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunkSBIT
member.summary:
sBIT chunk: http://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/#11sBIT
this chunk structure depends on the image type

member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunkSRGB
member.summary: sRGB chunk: http://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/#11sRGB

member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk
member.summary: Represents a instance of a PNG chunk
member.remarks:
Concrete classes should extend PngChunkSingle or PngChunkMultiple
Note that some methods/fields are type-specific (GetOrderingConstraint(), AllowsMultiple()) some are 'almost' type-specific (Id,Crit,Pub,Safe; the exception is PngUKNOWN), and some are instance-specific
Ref: http://www.libpng.org/pub/png/spec/1.2/PNG-Chunks.html

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk.Id
member.summary: 4 letters. The Id almost determines the concrete type (except for PngUKNOWN)

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk.Crit
member.summary: Standard basic properties, implicit in the Id

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk.Pub
member.summary: Standard basic properties, implicit in the Id

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk.Safe
member.summary: Standard basic properties, implicit in the Id

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk.ImgInfo
member.summary: Image basic info, mostly for some checks

member.name: P:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk.Priority
member.summary: For writing. Queued chunks with high priority will be written as soon as possible

member.name: P:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk.ChunkGroup
member.summary: Chunk group where it was read or writen

member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk.ChunkOrderingConstraint
member.summary: Restrictions for chunk ordering, for ancillary chunks

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk.ChunkOrderingConstraint.NONE
member.summary: No constraint, the chunk can go anywhere

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk.ChunkOrderingConstraint.BEFORE_PLTE_AND_IDAT
member.summary: Before PLTE (palette) - and hence, also before IDAT

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk.ChunkOrderingConstraint.AFTER_PLTE_BEFORE_IDAT
member.summary: After PLTE (palette), but before IDAT

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk.ChunkOrderingConstraint.BEFORE_IDAT
member.summary: Before IDAT (before or after PLTE)

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk.ChunkOrderingConstraint.NA
member.summary: Does not apply

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk.#ctor(System.String,Hjg.Pngcs.ImageInfo)
member.summary: Constructs an empty chunk

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk.FactoryRegister(System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: Registers a Chunk ID in the factory, to instantiate a given type
member.remarks: This can be called by client code to register additional chunk types

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk.FactoryFromId(System.String,Hjg.Pngcs.ImageInfo)
member.summary: Creates one new blank chunk of the corresponding type, according to factoryMap (PngChunkUNKNOWN if not known)

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk.ToString
member.summary: Basic info: Id, length, Type name

member.summary: Serialization. Creates a Raw chunk, ready for write, from this chunk content

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.PngChunk.ParseFromRaw(Hjg.Pngcs.Chunks.ChunkRaw)
member.summary: Deserialization. Given a Raw chunk, just rad, fills this chunk content

member.summary: Override to make a copy (normally deep) from other chunk

member.summary: This is implemented in PngChunkMultiple/PngChunSingle
member.returns: Allows more than one chunk of this type in a image

member.summary: Get ordering constrain

IDAT chunk http://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/#11IDAT
This object is dummy placeholder - We treat this chunk in a very different way than ancillary chnks

member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageLines
member.summary:
Wraps a set of rows from a image, read in a single operation, stored in a int[][] or byte[][] matrix
They can be a subset of the total rows, but in this case they are equispaced.
See also ImageLine

member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageInfo
member.summary: Simple immutable wrapper for basic image info
member.remarks: Some parameters are clearly redundant The constructor requires an 'ortogonal' subset http://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/#11IHDR

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageInfo.Cols
member.summary: Image width, in pixels

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageInfo.Rows
member.summary: Image height, in pixels

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageInfo.BitDepth
member.summary: Bits per sample (per channel) in the buffer.
member.remarks: This is 8 or 16 for RGB/ARGB images. For grayscale, it's 8 (or 1 2 4 ). For indexed images, number of bits per palette index (1 2 4 8).

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageInfo.Channels
member.summary: Number of channels, used in the buffer
member.remarks: WARNING: This is 3-4 for rgb/rgba, but 1 for palette/gray !

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageInfo.BitspPixel
member.summary: Bits used for each pixel in the buffer
member.remarks: equals channels * bitDepth

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageInfo.BytesPixel
member.summary: Bytes per pixel, rounded up
member.remarks: This is mainly for internal use (filter)

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageInfo.BytesPerRow
member.summary: Bytes per row, rounded up
member.remarks: equals ceil(bitspp*cols/8)

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageInfo.SamplesPerRow
member.summary: Samples (scalar values) per row
member.remarks: Equals cols * channels

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageInfo.SamplesPerRowPacked
member.summary: Number of values in our scanline, which might be packed.
member.remarks: Equals samplesPerRow if not packed. Elsewhere, it's lower For internal use, mostly.

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageInfo.Alpha
member.summary: flag: has alpha channel

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageInfo.Greyscale
member.summary: flag: is grayscale (G/GA)

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageInfo.Indexed
member.summary: flag: has palette

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageInfo.Packed
member.summary: flag: less than one byte per sample (bit depth 1-2-4)

member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageLine
member.summary: Lightweight wrapper for an image scanline, for read and write
member.remarks: It can be (usually it is) reused while iterating over the image lines See scanline field doc, to understand the format.

member.name: P:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageLine.ImgInfo
member.summary: ImageInfo (readonly inmutable)

member.name: P:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageLine.Scanline
member.summary: Samples of an image line
member.remarks:
The 'scanline' is an array of integers, corresponds to an image line (row) Except for 'packed' formats (gray/indexed with 1-2-4 bitdepth) each int is a "sample" (one for channel), (0-255 or 0-65535) in the respective PNG sequence sequence : (R G B R G B...) or (R G B A R G B A...) or (g g g ...) or ( i i i ) (palette index)
For bitdepth 1/2/4 ,and if samplesUnpacked=false, each value is a PACKED byte! To get an unpacked copy, see Pack() and its inverse Unpack()
To convert a indexed line to RGB balues, see ImageLineHelper.PalIdx2RGB() (cant do the reverse)

member.name: P:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageLine.ScanlineB
member.summary: Same as Scanline, but with one byte per sample. Only one of Scanline and ScanlineB is valid - this depends on SampleType}

member.name: P:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageLine.Rown
member.summary: tracks the current row number (from 0 to rows-1)

member.name: P:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageLine.ElementsPerRow
member.summary: Hown many elements has the scanline array =imgInfo.samplePerRowPacked, if packed, imgInfo.samplePerRow elsewhere

member.name: P:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageLine.maxSampleVal
member.summary: Maximum sample value that this line admits: typically 255; less if bitdepth less than 8, 65535 if 16bits

member.name: P:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageLine.SampleType
member.summary: Determines if samples are stored in integers or in bytes

member.name: P:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageLine.SamplesUnpacked
member.summary: True: each scanline element is a sample. False: each scanline element has severals samples packed in a byte

member.name: P:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageLine.FilterUsed
member.summary: informational only ; filled by the reader

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.ImageLine.#ctor(Hjg.Pngcs.ImageInfo,Hjg.Pngcs.ImageLine.ESampleType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs an ImageLine
member.param: If true and bitdepth less than 8, samples are unpacked. This has no effect if biddepth 8 or 16

members.member: size original: samplesPerRow sizeFinal: samplesPerRowPacked (trailing elements are trash!) *

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.FilterType.FILTER_VERYAGGRESSIVE
member.summary: Very aggressive and slow strategy: tries all filters for each row

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.FilterType.FILTER_UNKNOWN

member.name: T:Hjg.Pngcs.PngReader
member.summary: Reads a PNG image, line by line
member.remarks:
The typical reading sequence is as follows:
1. At construction time, the header and IHDR chunk are read (basic image info)
2 (Optional) you can set some global options: UnpackedMode CrcCheckDisabled
3. (Optional) If you call GetMetadata() or or GetChunksLisk() before reading the pixels, the chunks before IDAT are automatically loaded and available
4a. The rows are read, one by one, with the ReadRowXXX methods: (ReadRowInt() , ReadRowByte(), etc) in order, from 0 to nrows-1 (you can skip or repeat rows, but not go backwards)
4b. Alternatively, you can read all rows, or a subset, in a single call: see ReadRowsInt(), ReadRowsByte() In general this consumes more memory, but for interlaced images this is equally efficient, and more so if reading a small subset of rows.
5. Read of the last row automatically loads the trailing chunks, and ends the reader.
6. End() forcibly finishes/aborts the reading and closes the stream

member.name: P:Hjg.Pngcs.PngReader.ImgInfo
member.summary: Basic image info, inmutable

member.name: F:Hjg.Pngcs.PngReader.filename
member.summary: filename, or description - merely informative, can be empty

member.name: P:Hjg.Pngcs.PngReader.ChunkLoadBehaviour
member.summary: Strategy for chunk loading. Default: LOAD_CHUNK_ALWAYS

member.name: P:Hjg.Pngcs.PngReader.ShouldCloseStream
member.summary: Should close the underlying Input Stream when ends?

member.name: P:Hjg.Pngcs.PngReader.MaxBytesMetadata
member.summary: Maximum amount of bytes from ancillary chunks to load in memory
member.remarks: Default: 5MB. 0: unlimited. If exceeded, chunks will be skipped

member.name: P:Hjg.Pngcs.PngReader.MaxTotalBytesRead
member.summary: Maximum total bytes to read from stream
member.remarks: Default: 200MB. 0: Unlimited. If exceeded, an exception will be thrown

member.name: P:Hjg.Pngcs.PngReader.SkipChunkMaxSize
member.summary: Maximum ancillary chunk size
member.remarks: Default: 2MB, 0: unlimited. Chunks exceeding this size will be skipped (nor even CRC checked)

member.name: P:Hjg.Pngcs.PngReader.SkipChunkIds
member.summary: Ancillary chunks to skip
member.remarks: Default: { "fdAT" }. chunks with these ids will be skipped (nor even CRC checked)

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.PngWriter.ComputeCompressionRatio
member.summary: Computes compressed size/raw size, approximate
member.remarks: Actually: compressed size = total size of IDAT data , raw size = uncompressed pixel bytes = rows * (bytesPerRow + 1)

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.PngWriter.WriteRowInt(System.Int32[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a full image row.
member.remarks: This must be called sequentially from n=0 to n=rows-1 One integer per sample , in the natural order: R G B R G B ... (or R G B A R G B A... if has alpha) The values should be between 0 and 255 for 8 bitspc images, and between 0- 65535 form 16 bitspc images (this applies also to the alpha channel if present) The array can be reused.
member.param: Number of row, from 0 (top) to rows-1 (bottom)

members.member: Writes all the pixels, calling writeRowInt() for each image row
Writes all the pixels, calling writeRowByte() for each image row

member.name: M:Hjg.Pngcs.PngWriter.SetFilterType(Hjg.Pngcs.FilterType)
member.summary: Sets internal prediction filter type, or strategy to choose it.
member.remarks:
This must be called just after constructor, before starting writing.
Recommended values: DEFAULT (default) or AGGRESIVE
member.param: One of the five prediction types or strategy to choose it
